meanings.definition: The quality or state of being easily broken into small fragments or crumbs.
meanings.sent1: The cake's crumbliness made it difficult to cut neatly.
meanings.sent2: I love the crumbliness of fresh cookies.
meanings.sent3: The crumbliness of the sandcastle made it look like a delicious dessert.
meanings.sent4: The old book's crumbliness was a testament to its age and history.
meanings.sent5: The crumbliness of the dry leaves underfoot sounded like a symphony of nature.

meanings.definition: The tendency of a substance to fall apart or disintegrate into small pieces.
meanings.sent1: The crumbliness of the cookie surprised me as it fell apart in my hand.
meanings.sent2: The crumbliness of the old wall made it easy to demolish.
meanings.sent3: The crumbliness of the bread made it a challenge to make a sandwich.
meanings.sent4: The crumbliness of the sand reminded me of a crumbling ancient ruin.
meanings.sent5: The crumbliness of the clay sculpture gave it a fragile beauty.
